title: The Sapienza University of Rome is instituted by Pope Boniface VIII.
text: • 1303 – The Sapienza University of Rome is instituted by Pope Boniface VIII.

title: Three Genoese galleys and a Byzantine blockade runner fight their way through an Ottoman blockading fleet a few weeks before the fall of Constantinople.
text: • 1453 – Three Genoese galleys and a Byzantine blockade runner fight their way through an Ottoman blockading fleet a few weeks before the fall of Constantinople.

title: Jacques Cartier begins his first voyage to what is today the east coast of Canada, Newfoundland and Labrador.
text: • 1534 – Jacques Cartier begins his first voyage to what is today the east coast of Canada, Newfoundland and Labrador.

title: The sun dog phenomenon observed over Stockholm and depicted in the famous painting Vädersolstavlan.
text: • 1535 – The sun dog phenomenon observed over Stockholm and depicted in the famous painting Vädersolstavlan.

title: Oliver Cromwell dissolves the Rump Parliament.
text: • 1653 – Oliver Cromwell dissolves the Rump Parliament.

title: Admiral Robert Blake destroys a Spanish silver fleet under heavy fire at the Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife.
text: • 1657 – Admiral Robert Blake destroys a Spanish silver fleet under heavy fire at the Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife.

title: Freedom of religion is granted to the Jews of New Amsterdam (later New York City).
text: • 1657 – Freedom of religion is granted to the Jews of New Amsterdam (later New York City).

title: Deposed monarch James II of England lays siege to Derry.
text: • 1689 – Deposed monarch James II of England lays siege to Derry.

title: Start of Konbaung
text: • 1752 – Start of Konbaung–Hanthawaddy War, a new phase in the Burmese Civil War (1740–57).

title: The Georgian king, Erekle II, abandoned by his Russian ally Count Totleben, wins a victory over Ottoman forces at Aspindza.
text: • 1770 – The Georgian king, Erekle II, abandoned by his Russian ally Count Totleben, wins a victory over Ottoman forces at Aspindza.

title: American Revolutionary War: The Siege of Boston begins, following the battles at Lexington and Concord.
text: • 1775 – American Revolutionary War: The Siege of Boston begins, following the battles at Lexington and Concord.

title: George Washington arrives at Grays Ferry, Philadelphia while en route to Manhattan for his inauguration.
text: • 1789 – George Washington arrives at Grays Ferry, Philadelphia while en route to Manhattan for his inauguration.

title: France declares war against the "King of Hungary and Bohemia", the beginning of French Revolutionary Wars.
text: • 1792 – France declares war against the "King of Hungary and Bohemia", the beginning of French Revolutionary Wars.

title: The Septinsular Republic is established.
text: • 1800 – The Septinsular Republic is established.

title: Two Austrian army corps in Bavaria are defeated by a First French Empire army led by Napoleon at the Battle of Abensberg on the second day of a four
text: • 1809 – Two Austrian army corps in Bavaria are defeated by a First French Empire army led by Napoleon at the Battle of Abensberg on the second day of a four-day campaign that ended in a French victory.

title: The Governor of Caracas, Venezuela declares independence from Spain.
text: • 1810 – The Governor of Caracas, Venezuela declares independence from Spain.

title: The case of Ashford v Thornton ends, with Abraham Thornton allowed to go free rather than face a retrial for murder, after his demand for trial by battle is upheld.
text: • 1818 – The case of Ashford v Thornton ends, with Abraham Thornton allowed to go free rather than face a retrial for murder, after his demand for trial by battle is upheld.

title: René Caillié becomes the second non
text: • 1828 – René Caillié becomes the second non-Muslim to enter (and the first to return from) Timbuktu, following Major Gordon Laing.

title: U.S. Congress passes an act creating the Wisconsin Territory.
text: • 1836 – U.S. Congress passes an act creating the Wisconsin Territory.

title: American Civil War: Robert E. Lee resigns his commission in the United States Army in order to command the forces of the state of Virginia.
text: • 1861 – American Civil War: Robert E. Lee resigns his commission in the United States Army in order to command the forces of the state of Virginia.

title: Louis Pasteur and Claude Bernard complete the experiment disproving the theory of spontaneous generation.
text: • 1862 – Louis Pasteur and Claude Bernard complete the experiment disproving the theory of spontaneous generation.

title: Astronomer Angelo Secchi demonstrates the Secchi disk, which measures water clarity, aboard Pope Pius IX's yacht, the L'Immaculata Concezion.
text: • 1865 – Astronomer Angelo Secchi demonstrates the Secchi disk, which measures water clarity, aboard Pope Pius IX's yacht, the L'Immaculata Concezion.

title: The April Uprising begins. Its suppression shocks European opinion, and Bulgarian independence becomes a condition for ending the Russo
text: • 1876 – The April Uprising begins. Its suppression shocks European opinion, and Bulgarian independence becomes a condition for ending the Russo-Turkish War.

title: Pope Leo XIII publishes the encyclical Humanum genus.
text: • 1884 – Pope Leo XIII publishes the encyclical Humanum genus.

title: U.S. President William McKinley signed a joint resolution to Congress for declaration of War against Spain, beginning the Spanish
text: • 1898 – U.S. President William McKinley signed a joint resolution to Congress for declaration of War against Spain, beginning the Spanish–American War.

title: Pierre and Marie Curie refine radium chloride.
text: • 1902 – Pierre and Marie Curie refine radium chloride.

title: Opening day of competition in the New South Wales Rugby League.
text: • 1908 – Opening day of competition in the New South Wales Rugby League.

title: Opening day for baseball's Tiger Stadium in Detroit, and Fenway Park in Boston.
text: • 1912 – Opening day for baseball's Tiger Stadium in Detroit, and Fenway Park in Boston.

title: Nineteen men, women, and children die in the Ludlow Massacre during a Colorado coal
text: • 1914 – Nineteen men, women, and children die in the Ludlow Massacre during a Colorado coal-miner's strike.

title: The Chicago Cubs play their first game at Weeghman Park (currently Wrigley Field), defeating the Cincinnati Reds 7
text: • 1916 – The Chicago Cubs play their first game at Weeghman Park (currently Wrigley Field), defeating the Cincinnati Reds 7–6 in 11 innings.

title: Manfred von Richthofen, a.k.a. The Red Baron, shoots down his 79th and 80th victims, his final victories before his death the following day.
text: • 1918 – Manfred von Richthofen, a.k.a. The Red Baron, shoots down his 79th and 80th victims, his final victories before his death the following day.

title: The Soviet government creates South Ossetian Autonomous Oblast within Georgian SSR.
text: • 1922 – The Soviet government creates South Ossetian Autonomous Oblast within Georgian SSR.

title: World War II: U.S. troops capture Leipzig, Germany, only to later cede the city to the Soviet Union.
text: • 1945 – World War II: U.S. troops capture Leipzig, Germany, only to later cede the city to the Soviet Union.

title: World War II: Führerbunker: Adolf Hitler makes his last trip to the surface to award Iron Crosses to boy soldiers of the Hitler Youth.
text: • 1945 – World War II: Führerbunker: Adolf Hitler makes his last trip to the surface to award Iron Crosses to boy soldiers of the Hitler Youth.

title: Twenty Jewish children used in medical experiments at Neuengamme are killed in the basement of the Bullenhuser Damm school.
text: • 1945 – Twenty Jewish children used in medical experiments at Neuengamme are killed in the basement of the Bullenhuser Damm school.

title: The League of Nations officially dissolves, giving most of its power to the United Nations.
text: • 1946 – The League of Nations officially dissolves, giving most of its power to the United Nations.

title: Cold War: Failure of the Bay of Pigs Invasion of US
text: • 1961 – Cold War: Failure of the Bay of Pigs Invasion of US-backed Cuban exiles against Cuba.

title: English politician Enoch Powell makes his controversial "Rivers of Blood" speech.
text: • 1968 – English politician Enoch Powell makes his controversial "Rivers of Blood" speech.

title: Apollo program: Apollo 16 lunar module, commanded by John Young and piloted by Charles Duke, lands on the moon.
text: • 1972 – Apollo program: Apollo 16 lunar module, commanded by John Young and piloted by Charles Duke, lands on the moon.

title: Columbine High School massacre: Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold killed 13 people and injured 24 others before committing suicide at Columbine High School in Columbine, Colorado.
text: • 1999 – Columbine High School massacre: Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold killed 13 people and injured 24 others before committing suicide at Columbine High School in Columbine, Colorado.

title: Johnson Space Center shooting: William Phillips with a handgun barricades himself in NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas before killing a male hostage and himself.
text: • 2007 – Johnson Space Center shooting: William Phillips with a handgun barricades himself in NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas before killing a male hostage and himself.

title: Danica Patrick wins the Indy Japan 300 becoming the first female driver in history to win an Indy car race.
text: • 2008 – Danica Patrick wins the Indy Japan 300 becoming the first female driver in history to win an Indy car race.

title: The Deepwater Horizon drilling rig explodes in the Gulf of Mexico, killing eleven workers and beginning an oil spill that would last six months.
text: • 2010 – The Deepwater Horizon drilling rig explodes in the Gulf of Mexico, killing eleven workers and beginning an oil spill that would last six months.

title: One hundred twenty
text: • 2012 – One hundred twenty-seven people are killed when a plane crashes in a residential area near the Benazir Bhutto International Airport near Islamabad, Pakistan.

title: A 6.6
text: • 2013 – A 6.6-magnitude earthquake strikes Lushan County, Ya'an, in China's Sichuan province, killing more than 150 people and injuring thousands.

title: Ten people are killed in a bomb attack on a convoy carrying food supplies to a United Nations compound in Garowe in the Somali region of Puntland.
text: • 2015 – Ten people are killed in a bomb attack on a convoy carrying food supplies to a United Nations compound in Garowe in the Somali region of Puntland.
